programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys discover the ultimate coin-op man cave hidden on a farm in upstate New York, and Frank hatches a plan to help lonely collectors find love.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Dozens of amateur racers hurtle through the Chilean capital of Santiago, with only gravity propelling their wacky homemade vehicles.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are suspicious when an elderly couple arrive from Mexico with five suitcases but no clothes, and a truck carrying garden furniture has something extra in the load.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The staging of the Aintree Grand National sees the team working flat-out trying to get two new police motorbikes converted in time. Second-in-command Tony finds himself on the wrong end of a 4x4 challenge.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May buy second-hand lorries and set about discovering how difficult it is to become an HGV driver. The Porsche 911 and Lamborghini Gallardo are put to the test, and Michael Parkinson is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff tackle the Baja 1000t off-road race. On the test track, a showdown is held between a Renault hot hatch, a Porsche sports car and an old Lamborghini. Guests Laurence and Emilia Fox drop in to the studio.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: The celebrity humiliation continues at the hands of wicked Greg Davies, as Bob Mortimer champions sausage meat and Sally Phillips returns to the womb.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Ben Miller, Henning Wehn, Doon Mackichan and Alex Brooker to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the ninth series of the comedy panel show. Features a stellar cast of celebrity guests, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Katy Brand, Ed Gamble, Suzannah Lipscomb and Amol Rajan join team captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe to answer questions about famous people who share the name Paul, with the winners earning the right to pick the greatest bearer of the moniker. Sue Perkins hosts.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the quiz with a difference, as comedians Phill Jupitus and Bridget Christie and Only Connect presenter Victoria Coren Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of public and private.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Guz Khan, Tom Davis and Harriet Kemsley are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: In the semi-final, Nish Kumar is presented with a coconut harness, while a blindfolded Sally Phillips handles a slice of bread.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? At Christmas
programme.desc: Rob Brydon introduces a seasonal special of the comedy panel game. Musical comedian Bill Bailey, actor and writer Ruth Jones, comedian and presenter Jo Brand and athlete-turned-presenter Kelly Holmes join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack, trying to hoodwink their opponents with a few festive fibs or facts about themselves.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actor David Mitchell hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz from October 2016, with Labour MP Chris Bryant and New Zealand comedian Rose Matafeo joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the ninth series of the comedy panel show. Features a stellar cast of celebrity guests, who try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Comedy game show hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster, in which leading comedians are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations and scored on how well they would deal with them. The first episode features Tom Allen, Rob Beckett, Jessica Knappett and Liza Tarbuck.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian is accused of starting a war, and the only way he can prove his innocence is through trial by combat.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: A profile of Robert Cecil, a formidable political operator who devised and established an extraordinary web of spies and informers designed to ensure King James I's security.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: Profile of Cardinal Richelieu, who as Louis XIII's diabolical chief minister, was feared and hated thanks to his complex spy network.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates one of history's most enduring mysteries as he goes on a world-wide search for the Holy Grail, visiting Glastonbury in Somerset, Wales, Valencia in Spain, and New York City to inspect four goblets that could be the ancient relic.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of London's Crossrail network, a project of staggering proportions, with 10,000 personnel working across 40 sites and on 118km of track. The focus should have been on the impressive engineering feat, though delays and budgets have become the focus of attention.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How China has developed one of the world's fastest high speed rail networks, allowing 75 million people across the country to reach Shanghai within an hour.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of the eruption of volcanos in the ocean. From these violent beginnings emerge islands and coral reefs that are home to a vast array of wildlife, including giant manta rays and vampire bugs that thrive in the tropical snow, after a process that takes millions of years. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of the Tokyo Skytree, the world's tallest free-standing tower, which uses liquid springs and safety glass to withstand earthquakes and high winds.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. However, as the German forces retreated, Poland fell victim to one of the most tragic events of the war, Documentary chronicling the Second World War.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: VE Day: Countdown to Peace
programme.desc: This compelling documentary celebrates the approaching 75th Anniversary of freedom and peace in Europe.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund writes Prince George a speech to help quell growing anarchy among the masses - but is none too pleased when the dim-witted royal hires a pair of superstitious actors to teach him how to deliver it properly. Comedy, guest starring Hugh Paddick and Kenneth Connor, with Rowan Atkinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund needs to get his hands on some cash and asks the Prince Regent for a raise - only to find the brainless royal has lost all his money playing cards. To remedy the situation, the butler decides he will have to find George a bride with a large dowry and introduces him to the daughter of a wealthy industrialist. Comedy, guest starring Miranda Richardson and Warren Clarke, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: The fearsome Duke of Wellington challenges Prince George to a duel. Edmund volunteers to take his place, secretly intending to have his insane Scottish cousin MacAdder fill in for him. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Fry, with Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Hugh Laurie.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The spies who worked during the American Civil War, including Elizabeth van Lew, whose effective network even smuggled out messages in hollow eggs.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the secretive Rosicrucian Order, whose members included Leonardo Da Vinci and Isaac Newton.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How China has developed one of the world's fastest high speed rail networks, allowing 75 million people across the country to reach Shanghai within an hour.

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Documentary examining the plants and animals that thrive in monsoon areas, narrated by Colin Salmon. Crested black macaques take advantage of an abundance of fruit, and maleo birds use the sun to incubate their eggs on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. On Java, locals climb volcanoes to offer live sacrifices in thanks for the peaks' help in precipitating rain and fertilising plants with ash. The frequent and heavy rains in Borneo have destroyed the soils, created fierce competition for scarce nutrients, and driven evolution to produce some curious creatures. The Rajah Brooke's pitcher encourages tree shrews to relieve themselves to obtain the substances it needs, while the Bornean red leech is capable of swallowing the giant blue earthworm in one gulp.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: The struggle for survival on the region's isolated islands, home to flightless parrots, burrowing bats, giant skinks and tree-dwelling kangaroos. The documentary reveals how the arrival of new species can upset the delicate natural balance, with disastrous consequences, and explores the human history of the region. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A fully relocatable polar research station in Antarctica, which was inspired by a revolutionary icebreaking ship and ingenious designs for pre-fabricated buildings.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The story of the Nazi quest to establish an Aryan race, which set out to subjugate the Jewish population with decrees and laws about citizenship and escalated to the use of execution camps and the horrors of the Holocaust. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: The Story of Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: The settings for the Trotter brothers' adventures, from their regular Peckham haunts to episodes that took them further afield.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of Africa's green belt, an area spanning 5,500km from Uganda in the east to Sierra Leone in the west, which is hotter, brighter and wetter than anywhere else on the continent, allowing plants to flourish. People and animals have learned to exploit this abundance - colobus monkeys have developed specialised bacteria-filled stomachs to neutralise the toxins found in their leafy diet, while the Bakaya and Fang tribes use plant poisons to stun their quarry when hunting.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary revealing how fresh water acts as a magnet to a variety of creatures on the world's most parched continent. Flocks of flamingos congregate on the inhospitable soda lakes of east Africa, giant crocodiles battle with buffalo on the banks of Zambia's Luangwa river, and cichlid fish use catfish as minders.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Field Marshal Montgomery's daring airborne plan to end the war by Christmas, which went a bridge too far at Arnhem.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Private Lives of the Monarchs
programme.desc: The lives of some of history's most iconic kings and queens. Tracy Borman explores Queen Victoria's relationship with her husband and her eldest son.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring China's wildlife continues with a journey to the Yunnan Province, where parallel mountain ranges channel mighty rivers from Tibet southward to the tropics, and the landscape provides a home to diverse species. While the mountain forests are home to red pandas, the valleys below contain jungles inhabited by gibbons, sunbirds and elephants.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Wildlife living on the Tibetan plateau - an inhospitable area the size of western Europe - including brown bears, yaks, giant sheep, snow leopards and the chiru or Tibetan antelope.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Built to shelter ancient China from hostile barbarians to the north, the Great Wall also serves as a cultural curtain, beyond which can be found a variety of traditions. This programme goes outside the Wall to meet tribes of reindeer herders on the Siberian border, and explores deserts to the north where ruined cities were once bustling staging posts for camel trains on the legendary Silk Road.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species.

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The country's diverse wildlife, beginning by exploring how rural Chinese peasants in the south have developed a relationship with the region's animal inhabitants - including how water buffalo are used in agriculture, and tamed cormorants help their owners to fish.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the decade's psychedelic music, featuring counter-culture classics by the Who, Pink Floyd, Joe Cocker, the Nice and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: The late 1960s saw the first regular transmission of colour television, and the music world followed the trend with the launch of BBC television show Colour Me Pop. This episode features some of the programme's highlights, including performances by the Who, the Kinks, the Small Faces, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band and the Jimi Hendrix Experience.

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc: Celebration of the supergroups and guitar heroes to emerge toward the end of the decade, including Pink Floyd, the Rolling Stones, Fleetwood Mac and Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: Sounds of the Seventies
programme.desc: Studio and concert performance from the decade, featuring the Who, Queen, David Bowie, the Moody Blues, the Rolling Stones and Elton John.

programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part two of two. Experts analyse the Princess's marriage to Lord Snowdon at the start of the 1960s. At home with celebrities and artists, they're riding the wave of a cultural and sexual revolution that's transforming Britain. The mystique of monarchy is being increasingly undermined by the emergence of a more open and egalitarian society.

programme.title: The Queen's Castle
programme.desc: The Knights of the Garter arrive at Windsor Castle for their annual lunch with members of the monarchy, which includes a complicated procession through the palace. The royal archives allow cameras to view nearly 200 years of photo albums, including the thousands of photographs from the Queen Mother's collection, and the castle clock-maker faces a race to ensure all 450 timepieces on the estate are turned back.

programme.title: The Architecture The Railways Built

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Exploring the relationship that has developed over thousands of years between the people who live in monsoon regions and the wildlife they share them with. In the rice paddies of Assam, India, farmers battle a herd of hungry elephants over their crops, while on the Philippine island of Palawan, near Borneo, people still hunt in the forest and live in caves for part of the year. The programme also looks at the impact of organised religion, meeting members of the Bishnoi sect who believe that all life is sacred and have even been known to lay down their lives to protect trees. Colin Salmon narrates.

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Efforts to preserve the marine life of the region, which is home to the world's richest coral reefs and an array of species, including whales, sharks, albatross and tuna. Despite millions of people relying on its fish stocks, the seas have very little protection and face various threats, with international fishing fleets taking a disastrous toll. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: Natural history documentary in which spy cameras camouflaged as various animals go 'undercover' in the animal world, getting up close and personal to film their behaviour. Spy Pup is immersed in wild dog life to explore their maternal love, and Spy Penguin records the turbulent action of the mating season, as a male Adelie penguin falls victim to a pebble thief that ruins his chances of love for the season. Spy Tortoise and Spy Bushbaby keep watch on chimpanzees, while in perhaps the most moving scenes, Spy Monkey becomes the focus of attention for a troop of concerned langurs who believe the motionless camera-creature has died.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.desc: Compo and Clegg gatecrash Foggy's trip to see a female friend in Wales. Comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

Starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Daniel Casey (Midsomer Murders), Shaun Dooley (Married Single Other), Paul Kaye (Two Thousand Acres of Sky) and Greg Hemphill (Still Game).

programme.desc: The body of a missing computer expert turns up in a hospital morgue under a false name, so the team reopens the investigation into his disappearance. The dead man worked for the Metropolitan Police, giving him access to a great deal of sensitive information - added to which, he was in contact with a group of online hackers. But he died of natural causes - so why was his body hidden, and by who? As the seasoned detectives unravel the mystery, Brian struggles to accept Steve as the new Ucos member, forcing Esther to intervene. Guest starring Sarah Smart and Alex Jennings.

programme.desc: Foggy takes Compo and Clegg on a nostalgic day out to the Keighley and Worth Valley Railway to ride on a steam train - but the trio soon interfere in matters that should not concern them. Brian Wilde, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.sub-title: In the Blink of an Eye
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective investigates when former war photographer Peter Rooker is found shot dead. It is not long before he uncovers a trail leading from tabloid newspaper baron Eddie Price and editor Melissa Booth to an executed Bosnian family, but when he enlists his wife's help in determining the psychological history behind the murder, a fatal chain of events begins.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The death of a teenage tennis star occupies the team when it is suggested her suicide jump two years earlier was anything but. They soon find several people with motives for her murder, including her coach Nick and agent Anthony, but it seems the one with the most to benefit from the girl's demise was her great rival Fawn Brammall - a shy and subdued player who proves difficult to question. Meanwhile, Gerry wonders if he did enough to encourage his own daughter's sporting ambitions and Brian hatches a plan to turn his dog into a movie star. Detective drama, guest starring Tamzin Outhwaite and Alexei Sayle.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A boxing match ends in what appears to be an accidental tragedy, but forensic pathologist Sam Ryan's suspicions are aroused by unexplained injuries to the victim's brain. Unfortunately, she finds herself struggling to convince ex-lover DS Peter Ross that the boxing authorities are suppressing the facts. Starring Amanda Burton, Mick Ford, William Armstrong and Ruth McCabe.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Smithy tells Sheelagh that Gabriel raped Kerry Young, while Gina makes a bad impression on new boss Amanda Prosser by throwing a drink over a copper from Barton Street station.

programme.title: London's Burning

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: An ex-serviceman dies suddenly in the street, and Father Brown is called to investigate Danvers Retreat, a facility where the dead man was a patient. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The grand opening of Pryde Castle ends in disaster when a guide is struck by an arrow, and Father Brown becomes convinced that the motive lies buried in the Pryde family's past. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams as a Roman Catholic priest who attempts to solve various misdemeanours.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Convicted killer Violet is given a temporary reprieve from the gallows, and begs Father Brown to help prove her innocence. However, with only three days in which to do it, he must try to find the real culprit before it's too late. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mysterious disappearance of an old friend leads Father Brown and Sid on a quest to find the mythical Lannington Rosary, and an old adversary, seemingly back from the dead, must be trusted to help. Mark Williams stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Armed only with a telescope, the priest hopes that a broken leg will not prevent him from solving the mystery surrounding the death of a member of Kembleford's Women's Institute. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Sorcha Cusack, Nancy Carroll and Tom Chambers.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: The body of a young police officer is found in the station and fear grips the town as nobody knows why the killer would target the police.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Richard Poole meets up with a group of old university friends who have arrived on the island for a reunion, only for tragedy to strike when the man who has solved so many murders becomes the victim. Faced with such a sensitive crime, the commissioner quickly drafts in another British inspector to help the team get to the bottom of the mystery. It soon becomes clear that the newcomer, Humphrey Goodman, is just as eccentric as Poole - but he is also just as bright, and wastes no time questioning the partygoers, all of whom are prime suspects, while pondering the biggest mystery of all - how did the culprit commit the crime in full view of all the other guests? Kris Marshall joins the cast, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A zombie movie being filmed on the island ends in real-life horror when a stand-in is poisoned - and new detective inspector Humphrey soon deduces that the unfortunate victim was not the killer's intended target. He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A woman becomes convinced she has contracted syphilis from her husband, who indignantly claims he has never had an affair - raising suspicions that she is the one who has been unfaithful. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques expert stumbles on what seems to be a bargain in Frankie's scrap yard in the shape of an iron cannon. Though convinced his luck must finally have changed, problems lie ahead when the item attracts the attention of a devious major. Tongue-in-cheek drama, with Ian McShane and guest star Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Ram-raiders destroy a valuable Sheraton desk and steal what they haven't broken, forcing the roguish dealer to scout around for new stock. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer gets involved in a con at a country house involving the sale of a fake painting in exchange for a parcel of diamonds. However, Lovejoy later realises he too has been set up over the deal. Richard Griffiths guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Death in Paradise

He believes the culprit was after lead actress Lexi Cunningham, but the murder plot went wrong. The Caribbean cops focus their attention on three suspects - film director Carl Collins, screenwriter Arnold Finch and production assistant Susie Jenkins. But why would any of them want the star dead? Michelle Ryan, Peter Davison and Hannah Tointon guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and the team are called upon to investigate the death of Fidel's old school friend, Carlton Paris, who has been shot at home. The victim was last seen alive at an art gallery with Dorothy Foster, a wealthy older woman - and before long they discover he made his living as an escort and had left several disgruntled and heartbroken women in his wake, including a local judge and the wife of a club owner. But as the investigation progresses, Fidel struggles to keep his emotions in check, forcing him to confront some long-buried issues. Kris Marshall and Gary Carr star, with guest appearances from Adrian Scarborough, Sharon Small, Tristan Gemmill and Josette Simon.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A flight attendant is poisoned during her crew's overnight stay on the island. Humphrey and his team are called to the victim's hotel and begin by questioning her colleagues, but with so many suspects and so little to go on, they are left scratching their heads trying to work out which of her colleagues wanted her dead - so Dwayne goes rogue to pursue his own line of inquiry. Kris Marshall and Danny John-Jules star in the light-hearted Caribbean crime drama.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island's commerce minister is shot dead in his home, and with the incident coming shortly after the exposure of a scandalous affair - not to mention a suicide note at the scene - it looks like an open-and-shut case. But Humphrey isn't convinced and believes someone else was responsible for the killing, whittling down the possible suspects to leave his betrayed wife, his son and his mistress in the frame. The rest of the team struggles to see past the physical evidence, which still suggests he took his own life - and then matters are complicated even further when Camille gets a blast from the past.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Darkness Before The Dawn - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. A constable is shot in a botched raid on an opium den led by Watts, and Murdoch suspects John is being framed for murder by Inspector McWorthy.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc: Humphrey and his colleagues are called to a neighbouring private island whose property developer owner has been shot dead at a family gathering. Five people are in the frame - the victim's housekeeper, his PA and his three children - although when an approaching hurricane strands the cops on the island, knocking out the phones and computers, they are forced to rely on good old-fashioned investigative techniques. As evening approaches, the cops realise they will be spending the night in a house with a killer. Can they solve the mystery before he or she strikes again? Jimmy Akingbola (Holby's Antoine Malick) and Nikki Amuka-Bird (Luther) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: DI Goodman is called in to investigate the death of former surgeon Emma Redding at a retirement home. With an empty packet of sleeping pills beside her body and her room locked from the inside, it looks like an open-and-shut case of suicide. However, the team discovers everything is not as it seems and mounting evidence suggests she may in fact have been poisoned. Then, a blast from Humphrey's past arrives unexpectedly on the island, and looks set to distract him from solving the case. Guest starring Rupert Vansittart, Joanna David, Phil Davis and Michele Dotrice.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Back on the murder squad, Pat is asked to investigate when a young mother of two, Diane Leach, is abducted from a local wood. The confession of a local sex offender complicates matters, as Pat looks into the possibility that the father of a young protege of the woman may be responsible for her disappearance. Meanwhile, Walker has worries of his own, as his ex-wife Lyn is dating an abusive, unstable man, who turns into a manic-obsessive when she decides to leave him.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.sub-title: A Rose by Any Other Name
programme.desc: A middle-aged widow's family become convinced a photographer is only marrying her for money and ask Hetty to investigate. Given a week to probe his past and find out whether he's a gold-digging cad or a 24-carat gentleman, the unlikely sleuth unearths some extremely interesting facts. Drama based on the novel by David Cook, starring Patricia Routledge and Derek Benfield.

programme.title: The Bill

programme.desc: Neil Manson and estranged wife Pippa consider getting back together, while Gabriel takes the opposite course in his private life and decides to stop seeing secret girlfriend Zoe Dowman. Sheelagh brings daughter Siobhan into the station to experience a day in the life of a police officer, while Jack Meadows and the CID team investigate the source of fake passports being printed somewhere in Sun Hill.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Michael faces his appeal hearing, and uses the opportunity to try to patch things up with Connie, while Sam shares a secret with Chrissie. Lola discovers Leanne's father Steve has been admitted, and becomes convinced he is a drug user.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Holby A&E is at full stretch coping with victims of an explosion at the scene of a road accident, while Colette decides to teach Patrick a lesson for his lack of charm. Holly is roped into a PR initiative and Charlie returns to work with a vengeance. Derek Thompson and Ian Kelsey star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amanda Prosser steals all the credit for Gina's impressive initiative on antisocial behaviour, and teenage rapist Ross Trescot begs June to drop the charges against him, trying to excuse his actions by claiming to be a victim of sexual abuse. Roger finds himself attracted to a mugging victim's housemate, while Jo Masters and Suzie Sim present Neil with incriminating photographs of his father-in-law.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Mark, Michelle, Clem and Shelly set off for their weekend away, and in the square Gita's suspicions are aroused.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Shelly struggles to come to terms with Mark revealing his HIV status to her. Clem confronts Mark after he assumes Mark spent the night with Shelly.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch forget their personal problems as a band's video shoot ends in a massive blaze in a disused factory, presenting the team with one of their biggest challenges yet.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul strives to create a good impression on Lucy's parents, and Ewan makes an unwelcome discovery about his father. Donald looks forward to cruising the open road in the Morgan, while Isobel and Jess get their wires crossed when they pass a wedding shop.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Drama about community nurses living and working in a small Yorkshire town.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Tracey and Sharon witness a robbery committed by someone they know, leaving them agonising over whether to turn a blind eye or inform on a mate. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.desc: Boycie faces his worst nightmare when Marlene's sister decides to pay a visit from Peckham. As if the man-eating glamourpuss was not enough to cope with, he finds all his staff tied up in the barn - and realises his past has come back to haunt him. Guest starring Paula Wilcox.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Yorkshire
programme.desc: When Sid and Wally are seen disappearing into the woods, their wives Ivy and Nora wonder what they are up to, so press Compo, Clegg and Foggy to find out. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, written by Roy Clarke.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy criticises local folklore and upsets Compo and Clegg by condemning a Yorkshire god called Earnshaw. However, subsequent events suggest he has been foolish to voice his opinions. Long-running comedy, starring Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo takes on a distressing case in which a waste incinerator company is accused of deliberately hiding a design fault, with harmful consequences for the community. Meanwhile, the home secretary is accused of accepting a bribe - but the evidence goes missing, enabling him to call for Deed's impeachment. Starring Martin Shaw, with Jenny Seagrove and Aneirin Hughes.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of an East German immigrant, but all they have to go on are his mysterious final words, which translate as 'blue flower'. As they piece together his remarkable story, Sandra tries to gain the trust of his estranged daughter. Crime drama, starring Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Ross is certain there's more to a woman's death than meets the eye, and suspects there's a link with another unsolved murder. However, Sam remains unconvinced and, as she struggles to cope with the lingering memory of a previous case, begins to question her future. Amanda Burton, Mick Ford and William Armstrong star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Amanda Prosser steals all the credit for Gina's impressive initiative on antisocial behaviour, and teenage rapist Ross Trescot begs June to drop the charges against him, trying to excuse his actions by claiming to be a victim of sexual abuse. Roger finds himself attracted to a mugging victim's housemate, while Jo Masters and Suzie Sim present Neil with incriminating photographs of his father-in-law.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch forget their personal problems as a band's video shoot ends in a massive blaze in a disused factory, presenting the team with one of their biggest challenges yet.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Murdo, Renee, Don and Anette pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will hasn't returned home and Harriet is in the dark over what is going on, while an excited Rishi decides he wants to go camping for his 70th birthday. Priya is disappointed that she has to attend her father's party over spending time with Al, and Belle frets at the thought of Jamie going on holiday with Andrea.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: An exhausted Yasmeen sits in her police cell while the police search No 6 for evidence, unaware that they are being filmed on Geoff's CCTV. Alya returns from Spain and heads straight to the police station, Gary leaps to Kelly's defence when Dev blames her for heaping so much trouble on Asha, and Adam and Sarah return from their honeymoon.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on a journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the second episode, Ryan, Adam and Scott attempt to find their inner zen at a huge meditation hall, and Scott gets a fiery fix-up Indian style by a hairdresser who prefers flames to scissors. Later, a special family meeting leads to showman Dougie hitting the stage in Mumbai.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets a 10-week-old collie who has been rejected by its mother, and helps to find a home for a mongrel called Hope who has been at Battersea for over 300 days. Elsewhere, Paul has got his work cut out when a family of nine whippets arrive on site, including some three-week-old puppies in need of some love.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Four short dramas depicting life in lockdown. The worst fears of paranoid, self-absorbed hypochondriac Mike have come true. There is an unstoppable virus that affects us all, and he can catch it just by breathing the same air as other people. As he struggles to cope with his fears during the Covid-19 outbreak, he insists on an online session with his old friend and therapist, Rochelle.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: Alice and Rob's relationship continues to disintegrate as evidence under questioning incriminates them further and the children grow closer to David. Meanwhile, Tom's attempts to save his marriage are destroyed by his subsequent arrest, and forensic evidence throws new light on David's original conviction.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five family and friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.desc: Game show of skill and quizzing ability in which contestants compete at a giant circular ice table for the chance to manoeuvre gliding sliders on a giant game board, hoping to eventually secure a jackpot of 10,000. Hosted by Mark Durden-Smith, with former Premier League referee Uriah Rennie.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers - and new for 2020, the camera cock-ups can be broadcast in glossy high definition. Highlights this evening include crashing drones, flying dirtbikes and popping skulls.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show
programme.sub-title: The Martin Lewis Money Show Live
programme.desc: Everyday life has changed dramatically with everyone facing more restrictions - and more uncertainty. Martin Lewis presents another live special in which he and Angellica Bell will be examining how coronavirus could affect finances, and taking viewers' questions on specific issues.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Policing Britain: Cops in Lockdown - Tonight
programme.desc: As lockdown continues across Britain, Tonight asks what life has been like for the police, tasked with keeping people safe during these unprecedented times. Rachel Younger follows officers from Merseyside Police to see the impact the pandemic is having on their ability to combat crime, and witnesses the particular crimes and behaviours they are encountering due to the lockdown.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: A grandad stops off outside his grandkids' window every day to mess about and make them smile. But his son-in-law, still hurting after being left by his wife, does not welcome these daily visits. David Threlfall and Eddie Marsan star in this one-off drama, which also features Eddie's children Blu and Bodhi.

programme.title: Innocent
programme.desc: David's exoneration allows him to regain custody of his children and intensifies the investigation into Rob, Alice and Tom, leading to a critical arrest. But as damaging accusations concerning DI Hudson's relationship with David threaten to derail the case, her determination to deliver justice finally begins to unravel the mystery of who killed Tara. Drama, starring Lee Ingleby, Hermione Norris, Daniel Ryan and Angel Coulby.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: The making of the drama series, produced by Oscar-nominated writer Jeff Pope, which saw the actors working in isolation, with help from their family members.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Liverpool, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to 1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Harriet is angry as Will continues to try to make excuses, while matters between Arthur and Archie get out of hand at Rishi's party, and Vanessa continues with her plans. Wendy is enthusiastic when Victoria leaves her alone with Harry for a brief period, and Dan reveals his fall yesterday has put him back further.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Imran watches on as a bewildered and upset Yasmeen is charged, while Paul puts pressure on Billy to chuck Kelly out of the flat after discovering her role in sharing Asha's video. Adam learns that Ali has left the area after pleading guilty to assaulting Gary, and David wakes with a start and realises with horror that he's missed Max's speech.

programme.title: Captain Tom's War
programme.desc: Just a week after his 100th birthday celebrations, NHS fundraiser extraordinaire and national treasure Captain Tom Moore marks another upcoming milestone in this documentary - 75 years since VJ Day and the end of the Second World War later this summer. He looks back on his time in the brutal Burma campaign and honours the soldiers who fought in what has since become known - with so much focus on the European battlefront and on today's VE Day commemoration - as the 'forgotten war'.

programme.title: Dad's Army (2016)
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: A young woman's murder is murdered in the vicinity of a library and museum owned by a wealthy philanthropist with an interest in global mysticism. It's a complicated investigation, which leads the detectives into a world of mysticism, erotica, drug addiction and tempestuous family dynamics. But as if the case were not enough to contend with, Van der Valk also finds himself fending off office gossip about himself and his newly single colleague Lucienne. Marc Warren stars as the shred Dutch detective, with Maimie McCoy and Luke Allen-Gale.

programme.desc: Rachel steps up to acting DI on a case that becomes bigger and more sinister than it first seemed. Meanwhile, Janet is glad of Rachel's return, having not known how much she was going to need her friend. Starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Squishy Predicament of Stanley Peet's Stinky Pits
programme.desc: Animation. George and Harold enlist Stanley Peet to help win the 'avocadgrow' contest..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: It's the biggest sporting event in Grimsby - the bog roll roll. All Dave has to do is chase the bog roll down the hill and catch it..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: The Spuds don't care about a carbon footprint, since George has come home with a haul of free electronics that they all want to test out..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The TV chef presents more highlights from the series, prepares a meal for Craig Revel Horwood, and offers tips on preparing mussels, rice pudding and steak bearnaise. Plus, recipes from Thomasina Miers, Frances Atkins and Galton Blackiston.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by chef Galton Blackiston for a tour of Cornwall. They sample some world-class ice cream before visiting Newlyn fish market to buy cod, which James cooks with oysters and tartare sauce. The trip concludes with a visit to Sennen beach, where they practice their oil painting and break out the barbecue.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Seville in southern Spain, starting at a convent where the nuns sell home-made sweets to visitors - a tradition that goes back 400 years. He also learns about iberico ham from deli owner Elio, and hooks up with local cookery teacher Ana to learn a few traditional recipes, before tour guide Lola takes him for a boating at the Plaza De Espana. Along the way, he rustles up a charred orange and spiced almond salad, a Spanish pork sandwich and a tapas selection.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a new garden for an eight-year-old girl in Nottingham, despite the worst weather they have ever experienced. Tilly Sawford was severely scalded in a freak accident six years ago and continues to require treatment to aid her recovery, leading to the staff at her local hospital recommending the family have a safe garden created for them, with a bold colour scheme and surprise areas for all of the children.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Peterborough, where Alys Dobbie deals with a cheeky seller, Tony Geering has to dig deep in an attempt to secure an item and Simon Schneider is hoping he will not have to pay a mint for a gold coin.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five police colleagues calling themselves Cop a Load of Us answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Alan Davies, Sally Phillips and Dr Ranj Singh to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which they must answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: ITV Football Classics
programme.sub-title: 1979 FA Cup Final - Arsenal v Man Utd
programme.desc: Arsenal v Manchester United. Gabriel Clarke introduces coverage of the 1979 FA Cup final at the old Wembley Stadium, which featured the likes of Pat Jennings and Liam Brady for the Gunners, and Joe Jordan and Jimmy Greenhoff for United. With commentary from Brian Moore and Brian Clough.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the semi-final of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK. With brand new obstacles to face, the course is more extreme than ever, as the best competitors from four heats return to fight it out for a place in the final.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hits the road one last time for the concluding installment in this second series of the open-air game show. Once again, Stephen is hitting the streets in a city somewhere in the UK, and setting the members of the public he meets along the way a succession of unusual challenges. Success in these games could give the contestants a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to a 1000 cash prize in the big finale game. This week, Stephen's final destination is Belfast.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts a revival of the classic game show. Today's panellists are Danny Dyer, Sally Phillips and Chris Kamara, who visit three mystery celebrity homes, and are challenged to guess the identities of the famous occupants.

programme.title: Gangster Squad (2013)
programme.desc: A New York gangster brings his criminal organisation to Los Angeles in 1949, rapidly seizing control of the city's criminal activity and corrupting the authorities to ensure no one stands up to him. The chief of police discreetly sets up a secret task force with the intention of bringing the mobster to justice. Crime thriller, starring Josh Brolin, Ryan Gosling and Sean Penn.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Alex falls asleep while guarding his father's castle, allowing Sykronior to turn Kingsland into his new holiday home.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tests out Fizz's latest invention, a three-piece swimsuit to make beachgoers look chic. Magoo mistakes him for the President..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz wants to cure Magoo's near-sightedness for good. He and Weasel go over to his house, only to be taken for Magoo's parents on a surprise visit..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz writes a genius plan on a note that gets stuck to Magoo's forehead. When Weasel tries to get it back, Magoo thinks he's being pursued by spies..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike has the perfect gift idea for Iris, flowers! The only snag is that Mike discovers he's horribly allergic.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike decides to try to win Iris's affection by singing her a romantic musical number.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A day on the beach turns into a desperate struggle to catch the sun for Mr Bean.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean arranges a last-minute birthday treat for Teddy, including a morning in a toy shop and burgers for lunch. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: In Aspen, Colorado, Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max are on a hike to find the Forgeti.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Costly Conundrum of The Calamitous Claylossus
programme.desc: Animation. A mysterious student with secret gifts has the whole school living in fear..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave wants to learn to play the drums at school, but is given the recorder. With a talent show around the corner, Dave gets practising..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave and Fuzzypeg the dog get dirty playing at the local dump, so dirty in fact that Fuzzypeg picks up an extremely grumpy flea..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In England's first National Park, the Peak District, James is joined by restaurateur Tessa Bramley, who serves him a beef fillet alongside vegetables from her own garden. He also takes part in an unusual contest - hen racing - where he challenges a local lad and world champion to a race. After discovering some award-winning gin, James meets a local forager and samples some of his elderflower wine. Finally, he uses some of the foraged elderflowers to make a delicious dessert.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Granada in southern Spain, where he learns about the famous Alhambra Palace, enjoys a lesson in flamenco dancing and visits the caves of Sacromante, home to a cooking school where he is taught to make classic tortilla and fried aubergines. Ainsley also samples Spanish hot chocolate - thick, creamy and flavoured with orange - and tries local delicacy piononos, with tour guide Katia. Along the way, he rustles up chicken with saffron potatoes and a classic seafood paella.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner are joined by Levi Roots,who prepares BBQ salmon, Nadia Sawalha, who makes Mexican chicken, and Shelina Permalloo, who demonstrates a banana and caramel dessert. Plus, recipes for slow-cooked steak chilli, salsa and guacamole, dairy-free coleslaw and a chocolate cake in a mug.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A prestigious golf club is the setting for murder when a player is bludgeoned to death on the 13th hole. Barnaby and Jones discover gambling, illegal money-lending and assault are rife among the snobbish members, who are also dismissive of the local villagers and only allow them on the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another body turns up, making the detectives doubly determined to catch this terror of the fairways. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with guest appearances by Nicholas Le Prevost, John Standing and real-life golfer Sam Torrance.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and his dealers are in Coventry, Warwickshire. Alison Chapman collides with a Scalextric car, Henry Nicholls has a laugh with Laurel and Hardy and David Ford tries to lasso a Wild West artefact.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hits the road one last time for the concluding installment in this second series of the open-air game show. Once again, Stephen is hitting the streets in a city somewhere in the UK, and setting the members of the public he meets along the way a succession of unusual challenges. programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as TV presenters Donna Air, Amanda Lamb, Sarah Greene and Dan Snow pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson returns with another series of the big-prize quiz, broadcast over six consecutive evenings this week. Six contestants are ready and waiting for the fastest finger first question, hoping to win a place opposite Jeremy and the chance to answer the 15 questions that could change their lives. If they get stuck, they always have the lifelines Ask the Audience, 50-50, Ask the Host and Phone a Friend available to them - and if they're lucky, like Charlotte Church in last month's celebrity show, one of their friends might just happen to be one of the Chasers.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: Marc Warren steps into the shoes of Barry Foster to take on the role of Dutch detective Van der Valk in this updated adaptation of the Amsterdam-based crime drama.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: The making of the drama series, produced by Oscar-nominated writer Jeff Pope, which saw the actors working in isolation, with help from their family members.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Alone, heavily pregnant and fed up with life, Mel faces having to go through the birth of her first child without the married father of her baby, who has chosen to stay with his wife and family. She is without even her own family, who have given her the cold shoulder. Sheridan Smith stars in first of four short dramas depicting life in lockdown during the Sheridan Smith stars in first of four short dramas depicting life in lockdown during the coronavirus pandemic.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Ex-convict Russell is far from happy to be isolated with his father Ron, who believes he has brought shame on the family. As Ron succumbs to the virus, Russell must put their differences aside to keep his spirits up. Starring Robert and Tom Glenister.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: Four short dramas depicting life in lockdown. The worst fears of paranoid, self-absorbed hypochondriac Mike have come true. There is an unstoppable virus that affects us all, and he can catch it just by breathing the same air as other people. As he struggles to cope with his fears during the Covid-19 outbreak, he insists on an online session with his old friend and therapist, Rochelle.

programme.title: Isolation Stories
programme.desc: A grandad stops off outside his grandkids' window every day to mess about and make them smile. But his son-in-law, still hurting after being left by his wife, does not welcome these daily visits. David Threlfall and Eddie Marsan star in this one-off drama, which also features Eddie's children Blu and Bodhi.

programme.title: Euro 96: The Summer Football Came Home
programme.desc: A look back at the tournament, which was staged in England and saw the hosts enjoy a memorable run to the semi-finals. Highlights on the field included Paul Gascoigne's individual brilliance against Scotland, Stuart Pearce's moment of redemption against Spain and the all-round excellence of England's demolition of the Dutch. With contributions from Terry Venables, Stuart Pearce, David Seaman and Teddy Sheringham.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve and Leanne view a nursery school for Oliver, but matters take a dramatic turn on their return home when Oliver suffers a seizure. Gail tells Sarah and David she expects them at her birthday soire at Number 8, and Cathy threatens to quit her job.

programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: How to Keep Your Dog Happy at Home
programme.desc: Tips on how to keep dogs mentally stimulated during lockdown. James Martin reveals how he looks after two pets with very different types of intelligence, and learns new tricks for keeping them both happy. Among the family pets featured are a border collie that has been trained to herd turkeys and a dog that takes great pleasure in getting stuck under a side table several times a day.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas embark on a journey to trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the second episode, Ryan, Adam and Scott attempt to find their inner zen at a huge meditation hall, and Scott gets a fiery fix-up Indian style by a hairdresser who prefers flames to scissors. Later, a special family meeting leads to showman Dougie hitting the stage in Mumbai.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
